block.p: Joshua Kopetersan, 29
Founder and chief exectuive, Half.com, an online marketplace
BOOK ''E Boys. The First inside Account of Venture Capitalists at Work'' by Randall E. Stross (2000)

WHY ''E Boys'' tells the inside story of Benchmark Capital, one of the premier venture capital Firms of the last decade. As an entrepreneur. I have been really interested (and sometimes amused) to see what goes on on the other side of the table, and to see how the six Benchmark partners determine which companies to back.''
Joshua Kopetersan, 29
Founder and chief exectuive, Half.com, an online marketplace
BOOK ''E Boys. The First inside Account of Venture Capitalists at Work'' by Randall E. Stross (2000)

WHY ''E Boys'' tells the inside story of Benchmark Capital, one of the premier venture capital Firms of the last decade. As an entrepreneur. I have been really interested (and sometimes amused) to see what goes on on the other side of the table, and to see how the six Benchmark partners determine which companies to back.''
Robert F. Moran, 49
President, North American stores, Petsmart
BOOK ''The Victors'' by Stephen E. Ambrose (1999)

WHY ''There is no better study in leadership than looking at it through the eyes of the troops on the front line, which Ambrose does so well, and I firmly believe that successfully revitalizing a company like Petsmart is fundamentally an exercise in leadership.''
Kristin McDonough, 54
Director of Science, Industry and Business Library, the New York Public Library.
BOOK ''The Tipping Point'' by Malcolm Gladwell (2000)
WHY ''His earlier article in The New Yorker grabbed me. As a librarian, I'm intrigued by his acknowledging the role of 'mavens,' his name for those of us who love to find, and pass on information.''
James W. Breyer, 38
Managing partner of Accel Partners, a venture capital firm
BOOK ''The Sportswriter'' by Richard Ford (1986)
WHY ''As is the case in another of my favorite novels. 'The Moviegoers' by Walker Percey, the humanity, vulnerability and passion of the central character is astonishing.''
Larry Bohn, 48
Chief executive, NetGenesis, an Internet market research group
BOOK ''Why We Buy'' by Paco Underhill (1999)
WHY ''He does analysis of retail consumer behavior and what makes retail research successful. I wanted to know how that could be applied to the online world.''
